author: Kim Stephens
title: Pauline Hanson’s One Nation: Candidate brands single mothers ‘lazy’
text:
A ONE Nation candidate has branded single mothers as lazy women who are raising “lazy and ugly children”, apparently forgetting his party leader is a single mother herself. 
David Archibald, the Pauline Hanson-led party’s Pilbara candidate in the upcoming West Australian election, says he stands by comments he made in 2015 that branded single mothers lazy and responsible for a “rapid rise in the portion of the population that is lazy and ugly”.
In an article he wrote in 2015 for the journal Quadrant, he called for welfare for single mothers to cease, saying they are “too lazy to attract and hold a mate”.
Single mothers are ‘too lazy to attract a mate’ according to One Nation’s David Archibald. Source: YouTube 
Ms Hanson has yet to comment on her candidate’s beliefs but an angry tweet fired off on Wednesday morning, widely assumed to be related to Mr Archibald’s comments, makes it clear she has no intention of doing so.
To all the fat lazy politicians & fat lazy journalists in the fat lazy media playing fat lazy, PC, identity politics- The answer is no.
— Pauline Hanson (@PaulineHansonOz) January 31, 2017 Ms Hanson, is a divorced mother of four children, and hence, a single mother.
She divorced her second husband, Mark Hanson, in 1987, when her children were six and three.
Her eldest two children from her first marriage were 14 and 11.
But Ms Hanson has also, in the past, expressed her own views about single mothers as welfare cheats.
In her maiden Senate speech last September, she said she wants single mothers to only get welfare for their first child.
She further urged women who found themselves single and with children to, “Get a job and start taking responsibility for your own actions”.
She, famously, ran a fish and chip shop in Ipswich before entering politics.
Her comments, however, pale into comparison with hose of Mr Archibald’s in 2015.
In the Quadrant article, which stemmed from former Prime Minister Tony Abbott’s comments about the “lifestyle choices” of residents of welfare-dependent remote Aboriginal communities, he asked why the “much-taxed rest of us” pay for the “lifestyle choices” of single mothers.
“These are women too lazy to attract and hold a mate, undoing the work of possibly three million years of evolutionary pressure,” he wrote.
“This will result in a rapid rise in the portion of the population that is lazy and ugly.
“We know what causes pregnancy these days, so everyone who gets pregnant outside of marriage is a volunteer.
Mr Archibald also took aim at disability pensioners and childcare as prime candidates for federal defending. Source: Facebook 
“This is an easy one for defending.”
Mr Archibald said this week he stood by the comments, which also took aim at disability pensioners and federally-funded childcare.
The two-year-old comments ignited outrage.
Single mothers and children raised by lone mothers flooded his Facebook page to hurl insults.
“David, I just read your opinions about lazy single mums and the kids we bring into society. Yep I’m a single mum,” one woman wrote.
“I want you to schedule an appointment for me and my daughter to see you.
“In fact I challenge you. I’m very serious.
“Allow me to show you what a single parent and her daughter looks like.
“Just to give you a heads up on the conversation you might have with us, I have six degrees. My daughter has four.
“Now schedule that appt (sic) please.
“I think you might need to make a public apology.
“You ignorant man. Your comment about single mums is equivalent to saying every male is a pedophile (sic).”
One Nation candidate says single mothers are "lazy and ugly". Seems to have forgotten his party leader is a single mother too. #auspol 
— Eddy Jokovich (@EddyJokovich) January 31, 2017 Attacking single mothers yet leaving out 4 women dead this year form being attacked by partners! Thanks Labor for calling out this idiot! https://t.co/e3ELosYpf0 
— camybobany (@camybobany) January 31, 2017 How dare a fat, pathetic male have the audacity to attack single mothers. I would love five minutes with this fat piece of lard alone.
— Stephanie Hunter (@luxtraveldate) January 31, 2017 There have been widespread calls for Ms Hanson to dump Mr Archibald from the party, following a string of disendorsements of candidates in Queensland.
Far North Queensland candidate Peter Rogers was dumped after writing an article that claimed images of a Syrian toddler’s body washed up on a Turkish beach in 2015 were fabricated, along with the Port Arthur massacre in 1996.
Shan Ju Lin was sacked earlier last month for anti-gay comments, while Andy Semple withdrew his nomination after people within the party raised concerns about inappropriate comments he had made on Twitter.
Federal Labor frontbencher Anthony Albanese, the son of a single mother, also joined calls for the controversial candidate to be dumped.
“I have nothing but respect for my late mum and I regard his comments as incredibly, personally offensive but more importantly offensive towards all those single parents out there,” Mr Albanese told ABC radio.
He also made a pointed post about his mother in a Facebook post marking the 33rd anniversary of Medicare.
